more media consolidation. Sen. Bernie Sanders ( I., Vt.) decried the deal, as did Rep. Maxine Waters ( D., Calif.). DirecTV, in a filing with the FCC on Jan. 5, said the unprecedented array of assets would give Comcast new opportunities to gain unfair leverage over rivals to the detriment of consumers, later noting that "Comcast has a history of anticompetitive conduct, and the proposed transaction will give it the ability to enhance and extend that conduct."
